property.description: Set to Enabled to maintain a current working directory (CWD) for each task that accesses the file system, allowing relative paths to be used.\n\nSet to Disabled not to use a CWD, in which case full paths must be used for each file access.

Set to an index within FreeRTOS’s thread local storage array that is free for use by FreeRTOS+FAT. FreeRTOS+FAT will use two consecutive indexes from this that set by CWD Thread Local Index. The number of thread local storage pointers provided by FreeRTOS is set by configNUM_THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_POINTERS in FreeRTOSConfig.h.

constraint.display: Must be an integer and greater than 0

property.description:
Set to Enabled to include long file name support. Set to Disabled to exclude long file name support.

If long file name support is excluded then only 8.3 file names can be used. Long file names will be recognised, but ignored.

Users should familiarise themselves with any patent issues that may potentially exist around the use of long file names in FAT file systems before enabling long file name support.

Only used when LFN Support is set to Enabled.

Set to Enabled to include a file’s short name when listing a directory, i.e. when calling findfirst()/findnext(). The short name will be stored in the ‘pcShortName’ field of FF_DIRENT.

Set to Disabled to only include a file’s long name.

Set to Enabled to recognise and apply the case bits used by Windows XP+ when using short file names – storing file names such as “readme.TXT” or “SETUP.exe” in a short-name entry. This is the recommended setting for maximum compatibility.\n\nSet to Disabled to ignore the case bits.

Only used when LFN Support is set to Enabled.

Set to Enabled to use UTF-16 (wide-characters) for file and directory names.

Set to Disabled to use either 8-bit ASCII or UTF-8 for file and directory names (see the Unicode UTF8 Support).

Only used when LFN Support is set to Enabled.

Set to Enabled to use UTF-8 encoding for file and directory names.

Set to Disabled to use either 8-bit ASCII or UTF-16 for file and directory names (see the ffconfig_UTF_16_SUPPORT setting).

Set to Enabled to include FAT12 support.

Set to Disabled to exclude FAT12 support.

FAT16 and FAT32 are always enabled.

When writing and reading data, i/o becomes less efficient if sizes other than 512 bytes are being used. When set to Enabled each file handle will allocate a 512-byte character buffer to facilitate “unaligned access”.

Input and output to a disk uses buffers that are only flushed at the following times:

 When a new buffer is needed and no other buffers are available.
 When opening a buffer in READ mode for a sector that has just been changed.
 After creating, removing or closing a file or a directory.

Normally this is quick enough and it is efficient. If Cache Write Through is set to Enabled then buffers will also be flushed each time a buffer is released – which is less efficient but more secure.

In most cases, the FAT table has two identical copies on the disk, allowing the second copy to be used in the case of a read error. If

Set to Enabled to use both FATs – this is less efficient but more secure.

Set to Disabled to use only one FAT – the second FAT will never be written to.

Set to Enabled to have the number of free clusters and the first free cluster to be written to the FS info sector each time one of those values changes.\n\nSet to Disabled not to store these values in the FS info sector, making booting slower, but making changes faster.

Set to Enabled to maintain file and directory time stamps for creation, modify and last access.

Set to Disabled to exclude time stamps.

If time support is used, the following function must be supplied:

time_t FreeRTOS_time( time_t *pxTime );

FreeRTOS_time has the same semantics as the standard time() function.

Set to Enabled if the media is removable (such as a memory card).

Set to Disabled if the media is not removable.

When set to Enabled all file handles will be “invalidated” if the media is extracted. If set to Disabled then file handles will not be invalidated. In that case the user will have to confirm that the media is still present before every access.

Set to Enabled to determine the disk’s free space and the disk’s first free cluster when a disk is mounted.\n\nSet to Disabled to find these two values when they are first needed. Determining the values can take some time.
Set to Enabled to ‘trust’ the contents of the ‘ulLastFreeCluster’ and ulFreeClusterCount fields.\n\nSet to Disabled not to ‘trust’ these fields.

Set to Enabled to store recent paths in a cache, enabling much faster access when the path is deep within a directory structure at the expense of additional RAM usage.\n\nSet to Disabled to not use a path cache.
Only used if Path Cache is 1.\n\nSets the maximum number of paths that can exist in the patch cache at any one time.

constraint.display: Must be an integer and greater than 0

property.description: Set to Enabled to calculate a HASH value for each existing short file name. Use of HASH values can improve performance when working with large directories, or with files that have a similar name.\n\nSet to Disabled not to calculate a HASH value.
Only used if Hash Cache is set to Enabled\n\nSet to CRC8 or CRC16 to use 8-bit or 16-bit HASH values respectively.

Set to Enabled to add a parameter to ff_mkdir() that allows an entire directory tree to be created in one go, rather than having to create one directory in the tree at a time. For example mkdir( “/etc/settings/network”, pdTRUE );. Set to Disabled to use the normal mkdir() semantics (without the additional parameter).

Set to a function that will be used for all dynamic memory allocations. Setting to pvPortMalloc() will use the same memory allocator as FreeRTOS. For example: #define ffconfigMALLOC( size ) pvPortMalloc( size )

constraint.display: Name must be a valid C symbol

property.description: Set to a function that matches the above allocator defined with ffconfigMALLOC. Setting to vPortFree() will use the same memory free function as FreeRTOS. For example: #define ffconfigFREE( ptr ) vPortFree( ptr )

constraint.display: Name must be a valid C symbol

property.description: Set to Enabled to calculate the free size and volume size as a 64-bit number.\n\nSet to Disabled to calculate these values as a 32-bit number.
Defines the maximum number of partitions (and also logical partitions) that can be recognised.

constraint.display: Must be an integer and greater than 0

property.description: Defines how many drives can be combined in total. Should be set to at least 2.

constraint.display: Must be an integer and greater than 0

property.description: In case the low-level driver returns an error ‘FF_ERR_DRIVER_BUSY’, the library will pause for a number of ms, defined in ffconfigDRIVER_BUSY_SLEEP_MS before re-trying.

constraint.display: Must be an integer and greater than 0

property.description:
Set to Enabled to include the ff_fprintf() function in the build.

Set to Disabled to exclude the ff_fprintf() function from the build.

ff_fprintf() is quite a heavy function because it allocates RAM and brings in a lot of string and variable argument handling code. If ff_fprintf() is not being used then the code size can be reduced by setting fprintf Support to Disabled.
ff_fprintf() will allocate a buffer of this size in which it will create its formatted string. The buffer will be freed before the function exits.

constraint.display: Must be an integer and greater than 0

property.description: Function to call for print statements

constraint.display: Name must be a valid C symbol

property.description: Set to Enabled to inline some internal memory access functions.\n\nSet to Disabled not to use inline memory access functions.

Officially the only criteria to determine the FAT type (12, 16, or 32 bits) is the total number of clusters:

if( ulNumberOfClusters < 4085 ) : Volume is FAT12
if( ulNumberOfClusters < 65525 ) : Volume is FAT16
if( ulNumberOfClusters >= 65525 ) : Volume is FAT32
Not every formatted device follows the above rule.

Set to Enabled to perform additional checks over and above inspecting the number of clusters on a disk to determine the FAT type.

Set to Disabled to only look at the number of clusters on a disk to determine the FAT type.

Sets the maximum length for file names, including the path. Note that the value of this define is directly related to the maximum stack use of the +FAT library. In some API’s, a character buffer of size ‘ffconfigMAX_FILENAME’ will be declared on stack.

constraint.display: Must be an integer and greater than 0

property.description: By default, do not include the recursive function ff_deltree() as recursion breaches the coding standard - USE WITH CARE.

config.content:
/* * FreeRTOS+FAT Labs Build 160919a (C) 2016 Real Time Engineers ltd. * Authors include James Walmsley, Hein Tibosch and Richard Barry * ******************************************************************************* ***** NOTE ******* NOTE ******* NOTE ******* NOTE ******* NOTE ******* NOTE *** *** *** *** *** *** FREERTOS+FAT IS STILL IN THE LAB: *** *** *** *** Be aware we are still refining the FreeRTOS+FAT design, *** *** the source code does not yet fully conform to the strict quality and *** *** style standards mandated by Real Time Engineers ltd., and the *** *** documentation and testing is not necessarily complete. *** *** *** *** PLEASE REPORT EXPERIENCES USING THE SUPPORT RESOURCES FOUND ON THE *** *** URL: http://www.FreeRTOS.org/contact Active early adopters may, at *** *** the sole discretion of Real Time Engineers Ltd., be offered versions *** *** under a license other than that described below. *** *** *** *** *** ***** NOTE ******* NOTE ******* NOTE ******* NOTE ******* NOTE ******* NOTE *** ******************************************************************************* * * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of * this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of * the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, * subject to the following conditions: * * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all * copies or substantial portions of the Software. * * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS * FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR * COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER * IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN * CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE. * * 1 tab == 4 spaces! * * http://www.FreeRTOS.org * http://www.FreeRTOS.org/plus * http://www.FreeRTOS.org/labs * */
#ifdef __cplusplus extern "C" { #endif
#define ffconfigBYTE_ORDER (pdFREERTOS_LITTLE_ENDIAN) #ifndef ffconfigHAS_CWD #define ffconfigHAS_CWD (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfighas_cwd}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigCWD_THREAD_LOCAL_INDEX #define ffconfigCWD_THREAD_LOCAL_INDEX (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigcwd_thread_local_index}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigLFN_SUPPORT #define ffconfigLFN_SUPPORT (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfiglfn_support}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigINCLUDE_SHORT_NAME #define ffconfigINCLUDE_SHORT_NAME (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfiginclude_short_name}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigSHORTNAME_CASE #define ffconfigSHORTNAME_CASE (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigshortname_case}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigUNICODE_UTF16_SUPPORT #define ffconfigUNICODE_UTF16_SUPPORT (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigunicode_utf16_support}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigUNICODE_UTF8_SUPPORT #define ffconfigUNICODE_UTF8_SUPPORT (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigunicode_utf8_support}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigFAT12_SUPPORT #define ffconfigFAT12_SUPPORT (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigfat12_support}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigOPTIMISE_UNALIGNED_ACCESS #define ffconfigOPTIMISE_UNALIGNED_ACCESS (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigoptimise_unaligned_access}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigCACHE_WRITE_THROUGH #define ffconfigCACHE_WRITE_THROUGH (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigcache_write_through}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigWRITE_BOTH_FATS #define ffconfigWRITE_BOTH_FATS (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigwrite_both_fats}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigWRITE_FREE_COUNT #define ffconfigWRITE_FREE_COUNT (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigwrite_free_count}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigTIME_SUPPORT #define ffconfigTIME_SUPPORT (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigtime_support}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigREMOVABLE_MEDIA #define ffconfigREMOVABLE_MEDIA (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigremovable_media}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigMOUNT_FIND_FREE #define ffconfigMOUNT_FIND_FREE (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigmount_find_free}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigFSINFO_TRUSTED #define ffconfigFSINFO_TRUSTED (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigfsinfo_trusted}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigPATH_CACHE #define ffconfigPATH_CACHE (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigpath_cache}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigPATH_CACHE_DEPTH #define ffconfigPATH_CACHE_DEPTH (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigpath_cache_depth}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigHASH_CACHE #define ffconfigHASH_CACHE (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfighash_cache}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigHASH_FUNCTION #define ffconfigHASH_FUNCTION (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfighash_function}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigMKDIR_RECURSIVE #define ffconfigMKDIR_RECURSIVE (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigmkdir_recursive}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigMALLOC #if (BSP_CFG_RTOS == 2) #define ffconfigMALLOC (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigmalloc}) #elif (BSP_CFG_RTOS == 0) #define ffconfigMALLOC (malloc) #endif #endif #ifndef ffconfigFREE #if (BSP_CFG_RTOS == 2) #define ffconfigFREE (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigfree}) #elif (BSP_CFG_RTOS == 0) #define ffconfigFREE (free) #endif #endif #ifndef ffconfig64_NUM_SUPPORT #define ffconfig64_NUM_SUPPORT (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfig64_num_support}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigMAX_PARTITIONS #define ffconfigMAX_PARTITIONS (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigmax_partitions}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigMAX_FILE_SYS #define ffconfigMAX_FILE_SYS (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigmax_file_sys}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigDRIVER_BUSY_SLEEP_MS #define ffconfigDRIVER_BUSY_SLEEP_MS (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigdriver_busy_sleep_ms}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigFPRINTF_SUPPORT #define ffconfigFPRINTF_SUPPORT (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigfprintf_support}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigFPRINTF_BUFFER_LENGTH #define ffconfigFPRINTF_BUFFER_LENGTH (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigfprintf_buffer_length}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigINLINE_MEMORY_ACCESS #define ffconfigINLINE_MEMORY_ACCESS (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfiginline_memory_access}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigFAT_CHECK #define ffconfigFAT_CHECK (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigfat_check}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigMAX_FILENAME #define ffconfigMAX_FILENAME (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfigmax_filename}) #endif #ifndef ffconfigUSE_DELTREE #define ffconfigUSE_DELTREE (${config.freertosplus.fat.ffconfiguse_deltree}) #endif #ifndef FF_PRINTF #define FF_PRINTF ${config.freertosplus.fat.ff_printf} #endif
#ifdef __cplusplus } #endif

constraint.display: Requires dynamic memory allocation if FreeRTOS is used
Use FileX instead in Azure RTOS projects.
